title: Real Madrid 'considered appointing Conte as manager last year... but Ramos didn't want him'
text:
Real Madrid 'considered appointing Antonio Conte as their manager last year - but decided against it on the advice of captain Sergio Ramos.'

Conte is now managing Inter Milan, who are in fine form and top of Serie A after six wins from six - but it could have been very different for the ex-Chelsea man.

According to reports by Fichajes.net in Italy, Conte was the front-runner to take over at Real Madrid following the sacking of Julen Lopetegui in October last year.

Antonio Conte (right) is loving life at Inter Milan - but things could have been very different

According to reports, Sergio Ramos persuaded club chiefs not to hire Conte at Real Madrid

At the time, he was out of work having left Chelsea in the summer, but an intervention by captain Ramos vetoed the deal.

It has been reported that Ramos didn't want Conte, instead opting for Santiago Solari, who took over for just shy of five months before Zinedine Zidane's return.

Under the Frenchman in his second spell, Real have won just 45 per cent of their matches and the manager has come under significant pressure already.

At Inter Milan, meanwhile, Conte has won every league match he's managed.
